newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia's c. bank sells marks, kuna firms.
newsitem.headline: Croatia's c. bank sells marks, kuna firms.

text.p: Croatia's central bank said it intervened on the foreign exchange market on Wednesday by selling commercial banks 36.6 million German marks at an average rate of 3.5819 kuna.
The bank also bought from the banking sector 3.0 million marks at an average 3.5681 kuna to the mark, it said in a press release.

In a move unrelated to its operations, the kuna midrate for Thursday's dealings against the dollar firmed to 5.9601 from 5.9890. But the kuna-mark rate was little affected, firming very marginally to 3.5702 from 3.5710.
The midrates are calculated as a weighted average of commercial banks' sell rates and therefore immune to their large purchases.
